qas.question: What year did one the first community service usages of videoconferencing take place?
What company helped in the creation of community service videoconferencing?
What is the videoconferencing product that both IBM and PictureTel worked on?
What does DIANE in Project DIANE stand for?
How many years did it take for Project DIANE to grow?
Where was distance education first used?
What was first used  in neighborhood centers?

plausible_answers.text: a jointly developed desktop based videoconferencing product known as the PCS/1.

qas.question: What did a partnership between libraries and science museums promote in 1992?
In 1992 what are two places that were part of the PictureTel network?

plausible_answers.text: a multi-state cooperative public service and distance education network

qas.question: What did IBM Corporations grow to create over the next 15 years?

context: While <b6_0>videoconferencing technology<b6_0/> was initially used primarily <b5_0>within internal corporate communication networks<b5_0/>, one of the first community service usages of the technology started in <a0_0>1992<a0_0/> through a unique partnership with PictureTel and <a1_0>IBM<a1_0/> Corporations which at the time were promoting <b7_0>a jointly developed desktop based videoconferencing product known as the <a2_0>PCS/1<a2_0/>.<b7_0/> Over the next <a4_0>15<a4_0/> years, Project DIANE (<a3_0>Diversified Information and Assistance Network<a3_0/>) grew to utilize a variety of videoconferencing platforms to create <b9_0>a multi-state cooperative public service and distance education network<b9_0/> consisting of several hundred schools, neighborhood centers, <b8_0>libraries, science museums<b8_0/>, zoos and parks, public assistance centers, and other community oriented organizations.
